New Records: Walker Buehler became the first Dodgers pitcher to close out the World Series since 1916.
Freddie Freeman was named World Series MVP.
The Dodgers won their second World Series title in their new era.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers staged a comeback from a five-run deficit in the fifth inning.
Blake Treinen pitched 7 outs in relief.
Walker Buehler closed out the game with a scoreless frame.
Freddie Freeman provided a crucial two-run single to tie the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers were underdogs and their season was defined by resilience.
Manager David Roberts made tough decisions, including calling on Walker Buehler in emergency relief.
